model

Class InitJDBC

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.InitJDBC

  • public class InitJDBC
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Samuel LE BERRE & Gurvan LORANS-CANO

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InitJDBC()
      This is the constructor without parameter, it send many query to the DataBase to initialize it
      InitJDBC(java.lang.String dbName)
      This method will connect user to the DB without send any query

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connectDriver()
      This method will connect the driver JDBC
      void connectionDB(java.lang.String db_name)
      This method connect the user to the DataBase
      java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Get the Connection object
      java.lang.String getDb_Name()
      Get the name of the DataBase
      Table getTable()
      Get the Table
      Trigger getTrigger()
      Get the Trigger
      View getView()
      Get the View
      void noResultQuery(java.lang.String query)
      This method will serve for queries that doesn't need result, for example : CREATE [TABLE|VIEW|TRIGGER]
      java.lang.String[] query(java.lang.String query)
      This method will permit to send query some queries need result (SELECT QUERIES) and some other queries doesn't need result then this method will serve as a filter to start the correct method according to the result
      java.lang.String[] resultQuery(java.lang.String query)
      This method will be used for queries that needs result

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • query

        public java.lang.String[] query(java.lang.String query)
        This method will permit to send query some queries need result (SELECT QUERIES) and some other queries doesn't need result then this method will serve as a filter to start the correct method according to the result
        Parameters:
        query - The Query to send to the database
        Returns:
        The result if there is one

      • noResultQuery

        public void noResultQuery(java.lang.String query)
        This method will serve for queries that doesn't need result, for example : CREATE [TABLE|VIEW|TRIGGER]
        Parameters:
        query - The Query to send to the database

      • resultQuery

        public java.lang.String[] resultQuery(java.lang.String query)
        This method will be used for queries that needs result
        Parameters:
        query - The query to send to the database
        Returns:
        A String Array with at the 0 index the name of the table concerned and in at the 1 index the query
